column1: How do calcitonin or parathyroid hormone control blood calcium levels?

column3: Parathyroid hormone release is inhibited by increased calcium levels
column4: Parathyroid hormone stimulates bone resorbing cells to take up calcium
column5: Calcitonin inhibits parathyroid hormone 10 Endocrine System 209

column1: How do steroid hormones differ from amino acid-based hormones?
column2: steroid hormones are water soluble whereas amino acid based hormones are not.
column3: the receptors for steroid hormones are only in the cytoplasm or the nucleus (and amino acid-based hormones are not) 10 Endocrine System 199
column4: steroid hormones are made only in the adrenal glands, while amino acid- based hormones are produced by a variety of glands.
column5: steroid hormones activate a G-protein and exert their effect via “second messengers”, but the action of amino acid-based hormones results directly on binding to their receptor.
